title: geth synchronisation failed frequently and always out of date
body:
Hi there,

Geth
Version: 1.8.1-stable
Git Commit: 1e67410e88d2685bc54611a7c9f75c327b553ccc
Architecture: amd64
Protocol Versions: [63 62]
Network Id: 1
Go Version: go1.9.4
Operating System: linux
GOPATH=
GOROOT=/usr/local/go

My geth is always out of date, so that my Dapp which base on it always can't get the latest transaction information. 
Here is the error log of the geth:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7152596/40296191-8faa974c-5d0e-11e8-864f-d4aa246705e8.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7152596/40296228-9fccecd8-5d0e-11e8-827e-ee4003c1d3dc.png)

The geth gets errors and drops peers every several minutes and is out of date in most of the time.
And because the geth fails frequently, I run another parity node, which is in the same LAN, and the parity is always up to date.

I have tried to let my geth to sync with my parity node by add static-nodes.json, but they always disconnect for the error above.

Is there any way to let my geth node update to date(in most of the time, at least)?

Any help will be appreciated.
Based on those numbers, you're running Geth from an HDD? That won't really be reliable enough. You really should move the data directory over to SSD.

@karalabe 
My geth is running on a 300G SSD with 8G RAM, dual core cpus.
And I run iostat to monitor this device.

I have logged iostat and geth at the same time, and put the log in the attachments, which is just more than one hour. 
[iostat.txt](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/files/2022481/iostat.log)
[geth.txt](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/files/2022483/geth.log)

I also noticed that the device can be very busy when geth start to import more than one chain segment  after disconnect and reconnect. But the I/O is low when the geth is syncing smoothly.

Thanks.

@michaelgracie
My problem is not exactly the "65 issue".
Actually, the number can be dozens or hundreds.
And I have another parity node in the same LAN, which is always sync up to date. I addPeer(MY PARITY) in the geth console, but it still disconnects from time to time.
And i don't think the real problem in my issue is the disk I/O bottleneck.
I thinks this log: "Head headers broke chain ordering ... requested=5650169 received=5650362", can be the problem.
That chain ordering error is kinda funky, I'll need to look into whether it's a bug on our end or in Parity.

@karalabe 
I found many chain ordering error between some different nodes in my geth log, and I am not sure if these logs are all between geth and parity.

+1, this is exactly what we're seeing. sata3 ssd array, 4vcpu, 16gb ram, geth 1.8.7-stable (also tried with 1.8.1 and 1.8.3). geth log is basically identical to op's (including the head headers broke chain ordering msg, it's relatively rare though). no local parity nodes or predefined static nodes, merely 'normal' sync. also tried with maxpeers 50 and 100, no difference. the 30303 port is open inbound and outbound for both tcp and udp.

upon start/restart, the node starts catching up to the chain and eventually always succeeds. then, after running for some time, it starts lagging behind bit by bit ad infinitum due to synchronisation failed errors. if restarted, it starts synching with fast/normal speed again and catches up. it then intermittently stays in sync for a while (can be days), until eventually the block 'drift' creeps in again.

@vkjdarop 
Almost all the details you describe above are what I found since I started my geth node half a year ago.
And then I tried parity, which is alway up to date. But when query datas, I think geth is faster.
That's why I have a geth node and a parity node, and try to addPeer(MY PARITY) to my geth node.
You may try parity.
I also experience this issue with geth 1.8.8-stable-2688dab4.

I have the same problem. Sounds exactly as @vkjdarop described.
Just restarted my geth 1.8.10-stable, catches up fine without any problems and then I get "Head headers broke chain ordering" followed by "Synchronisation failed, dropping peer" regularely every minute.

having the same problem with 1.8.16-stable
@karalabe what numbers are you looking at to determine whether the HW might be too slow? What are the metrics? Thanks.

I am seeing the same on 1.8.17-stable and on various different machines (All SSDs). Works fine shortly after a reset before it resurfaces

I seams to be a known problem with no good solution so far. Read what airswap.io had to do to get it working ... [https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1PAKhNb5LLi5C_96Q-SiW070isqJRTPiE_VDI7yQDtso/edit#slide=id.g4409971b59_0_50](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1PAKhNb5LLi5C_96Q-SiW070isqJRTPiE_VDI7yQDtso/edit#slide=id.g4409971b59_0_50)

I can also recommend the suggestions from the airswap slides @SvenMeyer posted. I basically came to the same conclusions to keep my nodes up and running.

Some tips:
- Set a larger cache (4GB or more)
- Use NVMe drives for data storage if possible (use AWS C5 class instances) 
- Limit max peers < 50 
- Do health checks and auto cycle node if not responding
- Compare node block height to external service like ethscan API, and cycle node if lagging

That said, it's a real pain having to do all of the above just to *hope* to keep nodes in sync, and many people can't afford those resources

I don't think this a problem with ssd. I am running a mainnet with 4core cpu 8 g ram 300g hdd .The node work well.

I meet the same issue after try to run `geth import`  in my local rinkeby testnet , and after rm the .ethereum directory (Ubuntu 18) and start geth it work well again.

@r3lik 
> What are the metrics? Thanks.

A good base line metric is that `mgasps` in sync log lines should be higher than `1.0`.
I general, your node should process one block in less than 5s. If that's not working,
you should consider upgrading the hardware. We're always looking to improve
performance.

@SvenMeyer It's fine to see error messages like that occasionally. 

I'm closing this couple of months have passed since it was opened and many improvements
to sync code have been implemented since then. Please open a new issue if you are still
experiencing problems with sync.
